stories.title: The Word of the Year Is: Sophistry

stories.text:
I moved to San Francisco after undergrad a few years ago to work at a unicorn as an engineer to learn with ambitions of doing my startup after a few years. I've ascended the ladder relatively quickly as the company has grown, but find myself increasingly bored with the work. I'm realizing it's time to do something new, but I'm not totally sure where to start.

Where would one go in the Bay Area to meet other people that are interested in working on new projects or ventures? Do in-person forums for talking about interesting topics (and potentially working on them) exist in the city? Note that I explicitly didn't say tech startups â€” I have pretty diverse interests, and I'd be very open to non-tech work, though tech startups are often interesting.

Apologies for this post being Bay Area-centric (though folks might have advice that generalizes).
stories.title: Ask HN: How should I meet people in the Bay Area working on interesting things?

stories.text:
If you have downloaded torrents, Axxo was one of the best recognisable names (individual or group) for having the best "packaged" movies, each around 700 MB (around 2005-6 till 2010). Thereafter, the legend vanished, and the crackdown on piracy became more vitriolic. 
So who was Axxo?
stories.title: Ask HN: Who Was Axxo?
